title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to deny Federal retirement benefits to Government officials convicted of certain crimes; to amend title 18, United States Code, to increase the penalties for certain corruption-related offenses; and for other purposes.
content: Congressional Anti-Corruption Act of 2005 - Adds offenses which, if committed by the President, a Member of Congress, or the head of an executive department, will make such an individual ineligible for a federal annuity or retired pay. Increases the maximum terms of imprisonment for such offenses and disqualifies anyone convicted of such offenses from acting as a lobbyist.
